text:
JMeter 2.0.1 doesn't reuse the HTTPS connections when use KeepAlive is selected.
 This causes a whole bunch of idle connections on the server and really messes
up any load testing because the server runs out of connections very quickly. 
The connections do get reused on non-SSL connections (HTTP).

The connections hang around until the server closes them based on it's timeout
for idle connections.
creator: Chris.Michels@nau.edu

text:
Does the HTTP HTTPClient Sampler (Alpha) behave in the same way, or is it just 
the original HTTP Sampler?

The original HTTP Sampler uses the underlying Java code, which gives no direct 
control over connection re-use - this was one of the reasons for trying the 
new HTTPClient code.

If you don't use keep-alive, does the server close the connections OK?
creator: sebb@apache.org
Chris.Michels@nau.edu
text: Yes, if you don't use keep-alives the connection is closed correctly.

As far as I can see, it's not possible to fix this for the default Java HTTP
implementation
creator: sebb@apache.org
